title: Field Applications Engineer
description:
Enphase Energy is a global energy technology company and leading provider of solar, battery, and electric vehicle charging products. Founded in 2006, Enphase transformed the solar industry with our revolutionary microinverter technology, which turns sunlight into a safe, reliable, resilient, and scalable source of energy to power our lives. Today, the Enphase Energy System helps people make, use, save, and sell their own power. Enphase is also one of the fastest growing and innovative clean energy companies in the world, with approximately 68 million products installed across more than 145 countries.



We are building teams that are designing, developing, and manufacturing next-generation energy technologies and our work environment is fast-paced, fun and full of exciting new projects.  

If you are passionate about advancing a more sustainable future, this is the perfect time to join Enphase!


**About the role:**



The Field Applications engineering team provides pre-sales support to Enphase regional sales team by interfacing with our installation partners and answering their technical questions. FAEs conduct design reviews of potential systems and share detailed product knowledge to ensure partners understand how to design and install systems in a code and manufacturer compliant manner. FAEs offer support of new product introduction (betas) by interfacing with installation partners and managing a program of multiple beta installations. FAEs offer in the field support of beta installations, or advanced troubleshooting of installed systems (20-40% travel).


**What will you do:**


* Support the Sales Organization with Product’s Technical Expertise
* Provide clear Customer Technical Requirements feedback to Product Management and Product Development Teams.
* Execute customer-facing Technical Product Adoption programs.
* Execute customer-facing New Product Introduction (NPI) field activities.
* Develop and deliver documentation such as: design guides, line diagrams, standard BOMs, technical briefs, best practices, and training.
* Engage in specialized System Designs support activities.
* Coordinate and execute field testing and feedback collection for new hardware and software.
* Close cooperation and alignment with Customer Support and Field Services to deliver a best-in-class Customer Support Experience.


  

**Who you are and what you bring:**
* BS in Engineering, Licensed Master Electrician
* Professional Engineer (P.E.) license in any jurisdiction a plus
* NABCEP certification a plus
* Practical and hands-on experience and expertise with distributed solar electric, energy storage and energy management applications
* 2+ years working for a company developing and delivering products and system solutions
* 2+ years of exposure to design, engineering, and construction of residential solar electric and energy storage systems
* Detailed understanding of PV and energy storage system performance and economic modeling
* Strong expertise, knowledge and hands-on skills troubleshooting electrical systems and data networks using tools such as multi-meters, power quality analyzers, data acquisition etc.
* Strong knowledge of NEC and system regulatory codes for PV and energy storage installations, including but not limited to the NFPA 70: National Electrical Code, PV Power System installation, IEEE1547, UL1741 and Rule 21 for the interconnection of distributed resources with power systems
* Experience in the use and implementation of inverters/converters, DC & AC systems and component interconnection methods between PV and energy storage systems and the grid including advanced grid functions
* Ability and willingness to travel locally, domestically and at times internationally as needed.
* Experience working remotely with strong self-management and interpersonal skills and proven record of establishing and maintaining working relationships with customers, peers and managers


**Benefits:**  

* Medical, Dental, and Vision Care
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA)
* ESPP
* Paid Vacation
* Paid Sick Time
* Tuition Reimbursement
* 10 Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
* Short Term Disability Insurance (STD) & Long-Term Disability Insurance (LTD)
* Life and Accidental Death and Dismemberment Benefits (AD&D)
* Voluntary (Optional) Life Insurance
* Pet Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP)


Please submit all resumes in English.



The base pay range for this position is $95,000 to $135,000 per year. This salary range may be modified in the future. The successful candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, education or training, work location, and market conditions. This position is also eligible for bonus, equity, and benefits.

title: Director, Product Management
description:
As the industry leader for innovative benefits administration solutions, we provide the Taft-Hartley community unmatched technology, capabilities and industry expertise while maintaining the highest-level customer service and support. For over forty years and leveraging the power of our Basys and ISSI technology platforms, Bridgeway Benefit Technologies is the leader in our market delivering reliable health and pension benefits processing, fund office administration, reporting and member service on a platform built for data security, regulatory compliance, and a lower total cost of ownership.



The Director of Product Management is a strategic leadership role at the heart of our mission to deliver exceptional software solutions. This leader will ensure our product offerings are not only innovative and market-leading but also meticulously tailored to the needs of our clients in the Taft-Hartley benefits administration market. You will drive the product strategy, roadmap, and feature definition for Bridgeway's core platforms, Basys and ISSI. Your visionary outlook, coupled with deep industry knowledge, will shape the future of our product portfolio, and uphold our commitment to excellence.

  



This position can be remote or on-site/hybrid in our Baltimore, MD or Maple Shade, NJ offices, with travel up to 20% of the time.

  


**Key Responsibilities****:**  



* Lead, mentor, and grow a team of high-achieving product management professionals, fostering a collaborative and results-driven product culture.
* Define and execute the product strategy and roadmap for our SaaS offerings, translating business strategy into actionable product plans.
* Interface with customers, partners, and internal stakeholders to identify market opportunities, gather requirements, and prioritize features.
* Champion a customer-first philosophy, ensuring user experience and satisfaction drive the product development process.
* Analyze market trends, competitive landscape, and regulatory dynamics to inform product decisions and strategic direction.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including engineering, design, marketing, sales, and support to ensure successful product launches and adoption.
* Define and monitor key performance indicators for product success, adjusting strategies as needed to meet business goals.
* Oversee lifecycle management from product conception through retirement, ensuring a seamless and efficient evolution of our product suite.

  


**Requirements****:**


* An experienced leader with a minimum of 5 years in product management, boasting a quantifiable track record of launching and scaling SaaS products
* A strategic thinker able to point to specific instances where your data analysis led to a product decision that resulted in at least a 20% uptick in adoption or revenue
* Proven track record of managing all aspects of a successful product throughout its lifecycle
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a multidisciplinary product team
* An analytical problem solver who employs data-driven decision-making
* Excellent communicator and presenter, able to articulate product vision and complex ideas to various audiences
* Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; an MBA or relevant master's degree is highly desirable

  



Bridgeway Benefit Technologies, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer.



Covid Message: We value the safety and well-being of our Bridgeway community which includes our staff, customers, business partners and beyond. Which is why our team has chosen to require staff to be fully vaccinated for all in-person business activities, whether that be on-site at our corporate office or traveling for business. Candidates should consider this requirement before applying.

title: Pre-Sales Architect - Dynamics 365 | Finance and Supply Chain Management (F&SCM)
description:
Stoneridge Software began with an idea: How can Microsoft implementations be done better? After considering the idea and continually seeing the need for a business partner who could successfully deliver software implementations, Eric Newell, Becky Newell and Cody Marshall founded Stoneridge Software. As a 2023 Inc. Best Workplaces Honoree, member of the Microsoft Inner Circle, and award winning Microsoft Solutions Partner for Business Applications and Modern Work, we’ve developed a proven process for project delivery, a laser focus on long-term support to empower our clients’ success and a way to enjoy our work with a high degree of integrity. We know how to use tenacity to get the work done but we also know how important it is to balance work with the rest of our lives. Stoneridge Software has cultivated a flexible working environment, flexible vacation time, paid parental leave, continuous learning and development, and social wellness initiatives that bring a sense of belonging to all.

Our team is dedicated to helping customers get it right when it comes to software implementation and technology. We play as hard as we work, we embrace every opportunity to learn and share our success. What are you waiting for? Join us!  

Stoneridge Software is looking for a **Dynamics 365 | Finance and Supply Chain Management (F&SCM)** evangelist to engage with our prospects to visualize solutions to solve their business needs and challenges. We are looking for a Pre-Sales Architect who will take a lead role in working with our prospects to address their business needs and provide them the solutions they need to be successful. We are looking for someone with excellent interpersonal skills and experience with D365 F&SCM solutions to make the right recommendations for prospects.
### **A Day in the Life**

+ Lead prospect discovery to learn customer needs and challenges
+ Collaborate closely with the sales team and prospect to solidify solution vision to address challenges and needs
+ Responsibility for the development of customized prospect and client solution demonstrations
+ Develop expertise in and position the Stoneridge Software implementation methodology
+ Attend sales and marketing meetings and keep CRM and related customer and project records up to date
+ Assist with preparation of Statements of Work with a focus on Scope and estimate
+ Conduct marketing focused webinars for clients and prospects
+ Able to present, demonstrate, and articulate technical solutions in a concise, clear, and convincing way to both technical and non-technical audiences
+ Lead technical discussion in all aspects of the technical sales cycle including product demonstrations, technical presentations, and requirement analysis

### **Preferred Qualifications**

+ Bachelor’s Degree in Business or related field
+ 5+ years of D365 F&SCM implementation experience
+ Experience in a D365 F&SCM consulting role preferred, some direct customer-facing role required
+ Preferred experience with Microsoft solutions
+ Knowledge of integration best practices with Microsoft D365 F&SCM
+ Broad business system knowledge
+ Capability to customize and configure MS Dynamics environment to demonstrate proof of concept to prospects and clients
+ Collaborative and work together as a team in the best interests of the team, prospects, and customers
+ Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English
 **Travel Required:** Incumbent is expected to periodically meet with client teams across the United States and will be asked to attend industry events from time to time.  

This position is available on a **REMOTE** basis in the United States or **REMOTE** in Canada (Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland, Nova Scotia, Ontario, Prince Edward Island, Saskatchewan).
### **Health and Wellness**

+ Medical Insurance (premiums for employees paid for by the company)
+ Dental Insurance
+ Vision insurance
+ 401(k) contribution program (US) or RRSP Benefits (Canada)
+ Life insurance
+ Disability Benefits
+ Paid parental leave
+ Paid flexible time off
+ Paid sick time (US) or floater days (Canada)
+ Paid holidays
+ Flexible work schedules
+ Mobile/internet reimbursement
+ Employee and family assistance program
+ Learning and development allowance
+ Employer charitable contribution
+ Social wellness clubs
+ Professional coaching
+ Paid business mileage
+ Home office and wellness allowance (US Only)
+ HSA contribution (US Only)
  


### **Compensation**

+ Our philosophy is to provide Competitive, Equitable, and Driven by Performance compensation. Various factors impact our pay ranges including market conditions and national salary data. To determine competitive salaries within this range we consider candidates skills, qualifications, and experience. These are national ranges, inclusive of bonus opportunities, and could represent multiple role levels.

US (USD): $134,100 - $178,200
Canada (CAD): C$145,500 - C$176,200
We live and breathe our core values:
Integrity | Technical Excellence | Tenacity | Client Centric | Enjoy Our Work

They are the fabric of our company and a reflection of our organizational culture. Our values are a part of our talent acquisition process, how we operate our company and how we partner with our clients. We enjoy our work by exhibiting our technical excellence and tenacity while being inherently client-centric with integrity toward every customer engagement.

Stoneridge Software is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status and all the other fascinating characteristics that make us unique. Growing the best team is at the center of our strategic plan. To be successful in this, we strive to create an inclusive environment and build a sense of belonging by celebrating our differences and ensuring fair and equitable treatment for all our team members.  

We will comply with local guidelines regarding infectious diseases and vaccine requirements. Team members who are required to travel to client sites, conferences and events that are not in Stoneridge Software offices, must comply with the client's COVID-19 policies and procedures or have an approved exemption.

title: Director of Business Development
description:
Description:

The Director of Business Development is a pivotal role responsible for leading the company's expansion in the federal contracting market. Reporting directly to the Chief Growth Officer (CGO) or Chief Executive Officer (CEO), this position is tasked with developing and executing a business development strategy that aligns with the company's growth objectives. The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of federal procurement processes, have a strong track record of securing federal contracts, and demonstrate exceptional leadership and strategic planning skills.

 **Location:**


Hybrid with potential travel as required.

**Business Development Director Job Responsibilities:**

* Identifies and develops new business opportunities.
* Builds relationships with customers, partners, and vendors.
* Manages key client relationships and works to build new ones.
* Expands the profile and reach of the company and its brand.
* Leads sales, marketing, customer-service, and client relationship management teams.
* Develops and strengthens internal and external relationships that will lead to increased lead generation and market share.
* Tracks emerging markets and trends.
* Provide Business Development training to company employees.
* Proposes and develops strategic partnerships.
* Helps to shape the company’s long-term objectives and determine plans for how to meet them.
* Researches and identifies new markets.
* Maintain the company’s business development pipeline.
* Identifies conferences, trade shows and sponsorship opportunities.
* Builds and maintains relationships with vendors.
* Conducts webinars and presentations to raise the brand or product profile.
* Travels to vendor locations, distribution centers, and other locations.
* Helps direct development of customer-facing web platforms and digital experiences.
* Other duties as assigned


Requirements: **Education, Experience, & Licensing Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s degree in business administration, marketing, or related field
* 5-10 years’ sales or marketing experience
* 3-5 years’ supervisory or management experience
* At least 5 years of experience in business development, with a minimum of 2 years dedicated to the federal contracting sector.


**Business Development Director Qualifications/Skills:**

* Relationship management
* Leadership, management, and mentoring skills
* Strategic planning skills
* Knowledge of federal market and IT sector
* Excellent presentation and communication skills
* Effective organizational skills
* Familiarity with technology and software development
* Research and analytical skills
* Interpersonal and customer-service skills
* Lead generation and management experience

**Additional Information:**

* In order to meet the clearance requirements for this opportunity, candidates must be **authorized to work in the US.**
* All candidates will be subject to a complete background check to include, but not limited to Criminal History, Education Verification, Professional Certification Verification, Verification of Previous Employment and Credit History.
* Public Trust background investigations can take approximately four to eight weeks and requires fingerprinting.

**Other Information:**

* The salary for this position is **$100,000 - $180,000** annually
* For information on SFI's benefits please visit http://www.spatialfront.com/pages/career.html

* Please no agencies, third parties, or corp-to-corp.

title: System Administrator, Varicent (Sales Compensation)
description:
**About Us**

At Cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better Internet. Today the company runs one of the world's largest networks that powers approximately 25 million Internet properties, for customers ranging from individual bloggers to SMBs to Fortune 500 companies. Cloudflare protects and accelerates any Internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code. Internet properties powered by Cloudflare all have web traffic routed through its intelligent global network, which gets smarter with every request. As a result, they see significant improvement in performance and a decrease in spam and other attacks. Cloudflare was named to Entrepreneur Magazine's Top Company Cultures list and ranked among the World's Most Innovative Companies by Fast Company.



We realize people do not fit into neat boxes. We are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. We cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. We hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at Cloudflare. Come join us!


#### **Available Locations: Remote US**


#### **What you'll do**



We are looking for a strong leader to join our team as a *Product Manager, Varicent* within the Finance & Business Operations Organization. As a key team member of a high-visibility organization, this role will provide both technical and operational support to Cloudflare's Global Commissions Tooling & Strategy.


**Responsibilities**


* Lead Strategic Direction, Product Vision, Customer Discovery, Feature Prioritization & Cross-functional alignment for Cloudflare's Commission Tech Stack
* Identify & implement leading practice architecture and build techniques, optimizing for scalability, flexibility and analytical intelligence
* Own & coordinate managed services resources, leveraging to execute and implement builds, enhancements and testing
* Implement robust and thorough change management processes and testing framework
* Employ a 'business-focused' approach to technical work; learn, understand and speak the language of key stakeholders and business partners
* Build extensive documentation and enablement infrastructure, scaling consistent practices, documentation and desktop procedures for tool functionality
* Build deep knowledge around and leverage relationships to influence outcomes and prioritization of upstream system enhancements which directly impact ICM practice (eg. HCM, CRM, etc.)
* Implement appropriate SOX Controls, partnering closely with the Controllership and Internal Audit Organizations


**Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience**


* 8+ years of Product Management, Technical Project Management, Consulting, or Incentive Compensation Administration; experience with a Saas business model preferred
* Firm grasp of the commission administrative process flow, including plan document distribution and tracking; transaction crediting; incentive calculations; payment file preparation; and issue resolution
* Experience or understanding of commissions-specific SOX Controls
* Experience with Varicent, Anaplan ICM, Xactly, Calidus or a similar ICM tool
* Experience with SQL platforms and queries
* Communication: Clear, concise communicator; ability to synthesize complex data or business problems into actionable information to drive results
* Versatility: Ability to multitask and thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment, zooming in with good attention to detail while still keeping the big picture in mind
* Project Management: Results-oriented, self-starter, organized, team-focused, and a strong work ethic, leveraging relationships to ensure deadlines are met


**Compensation**



Compensation may be adjusted depending on work location.


* For Colorado-based hires: Estimated annual salary of $128,000 - $156,000
* For New York City, Washington, and California (excluding Bay Area) based hires: Estimated annual salary of $143,000 - $175,000
* For Bay Area-based hires: Estimated annual salary of $150,000 - $184,000


**Equity**



This role is eligible to participate in Cloudflare's equity plan.


**Benefits**



Cloudflare offers a complete package of benefits and programs to support you and your family. Our benefits programs can help you pay health care expenses, support caregiving, build capital for the future and make life a little easier and fun! The below is a description of our benefits for employees in the United States, and benefits may vary for employees based outside the U.S.


**Health & Welfare Benefits**


* Medical/Rx Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Commuter Spending Accounts
* Fertility & Family Forming Benefits
* On-demand mental health support and Employee Assistance Program
* Global Travel Medical Insurance


**Financial Benefits**


* Short and Long Term Disability Insurance
* Life & Accident Insurance
* 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
* Employee Stock Participation Plan


**Time Off**


* Flexible paid time off covering vacation and sick leave
* Leave programs, including parental, pregnancy health, medical, and bereavement leave

 **What Makes Cloudflare Special?**



We're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. We're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. Fundamental to our mission to help build a better Internet is protecting the free and open Internet.


**Project Galileo**: We equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by Cloudflare's enterprise customers-at no cost.


**Athenian Project**: We created Athenian Project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.


**Path Forward Partnership**: Since 2016, we have partnered with Path Forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.


**1.1.1.1**: We released 1.1.1.1 to help fix the foundation of the Internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public DNS resolver. This is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service Cloudflare has ever released. Here's the deal - we don't store client IP addresses never, ever. We will continue to abide by our privacy commitment and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.



Sound like something you'd like to be a part of? We'd love to hear from you!



This position may require access to information protected under U.S. export control laws, including the U.S. Export Administration Regulations. Please note that any offer of employment may be conditioned on your authorization to receive software or technology controlled under these U.S. export laws without sponsorship for an export license.



Cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. We are an AA/Veterans/Disabled Employer.



Cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. Examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 Townsend St. San Francisco, CA 94107.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
About RocketRez
  
RocketRez is a leading SaaS company specializing in innovative solutions for the tourism and attractions industry. We are committed to providing cutting-edge software that empowers businesses to streamline operations, enhance customer experiences, and drive growth. As a Solutions Engineer at RocketRez, you will be at the forefront of transforming the way our clients interact with our products, playing a critical role in our success.
  
  

Position Overview
  
In the role of a Solutions Engineer, you will be a pivotal force in shaping our company's trajectory. Working closely with our Sales, Product, and Technical teams, you'll provide technical expertise and solutions tailored to our clients' unique needs. Your primary mission is to showcase the seamless integration of RocketRez's products into our clients' workflows through creative storytelling, ensuring our value proposition is communicated effectively throughout the sales cycle.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Collaborate with Sales and Technical teams to deeply understand client requirements and design customized software solutions.
* Provide technical expertise during pre-sales activities, including impactful product demonstrations, technical discussions, and solution design.
* Engage with the Product team to contribute insights for the development of new features and functionalities that meet client needs.
* Lead technical discussions with potential and existing customers, demonstrating the value of our platform and understanding their business objectives.
* Customize and integrate the RocketRez platform with customers' existing systems and third-party solutions, such as payment gateways, marketing automation tools, and CRM systems.
* Act as a trusted technical advisor, guiding customers on how to best leverage our platform to achieve their business goals.
* Comfortably present demos and technical solutions to C-level executives.
* Utilize expertise in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and API requests to enhance and customize software solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Management, Engineering, and Support, to develop and deliver custom solutions.
* Develop and maintain technical documentation, such as API guides and integration manuals, to support customers in using our platform.
* Participate in pre-sales activities, including technical demonstrations and proof of concepts, to acquire new business and expand our customer base.
* Provide valuable feedback to the Product team on the roadmap and feature development based on customer needs and market trends.
* Occasional travel for tradeshows and client meetings (typically a couple of times a year, but subject to business needs).


**Qualifications and Experience:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
* 3+ years of experience in a technical role, such as software engineering, sales engineering, or technical consulting.
* Strong technical skills, including experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and API integrations.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders effectively.
* Experience working with cross-functional teams, particularly with technical teams (Product, Sales, Marketing, Professional Services).
* Some sales experience, as collaboration with Account Executives is crucial for driving opportunities forward.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to develop solutions.
* Experience working with clients in the tourism or attractions industry is a plus.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Why Join RocketRez
  
At RocketRez, we believe in fostering an environment where creativity and innovation thrive. As a Solutions Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of our products and services. This is a unique opportunity for career growth, where your contributions will directly impact the success of RocketRez and our clients. Join us on this exciting journey and be part of a dynamic team committed to pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the tours and attractions industry.
  
  

RocketRez is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Solution Architect and Team Lead
description:
**Long View. A career that helps you get more out of life.**A Long View career helps you get more out of life. We don’t just say it, we prove it. Every day. We’re proud of our reputation as one of North America’s most dynamic IT providers — and we’re even prouder of our culture that allows our people to live life to its fullest. At Long View, we create an environment of collaboration and support, of innovation and enthusiasm, of inclusion and belonging. As a member of the Long View team, you’ll see how our company’s core pillars — Integrity, Competence, Value, and Fun — resonate through the workplace. And in a recent survey, 90% of Long View team members rated Long View as a good or great place to work! **Are you passionate about leading people and going above and beyond to deliver an exceptional experience for clients?**  

We are looking for Dynamics 365 F&O Solution Architect and Team Lead for Data and Dynamics team, leading the design and implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations solutions across the organization You will have a deep understanding of Dynamics 365 F&O functionalities, business processes, and industry best practices, along with strong leadership and communication skills to effectively manage a team of consultants and developers.
### **A Day in the Life:**

* Responsible for overseeing design, architecture, and implementation of various Dynamics 365 F&O solution components, as well as support efforts of solution consultants in other technical and business disciplines.
* Design, implement and Support Long View’s Business Application D365 Finance & Operation portfolio by working with customers and internal stakeholders (business clients, business analysts, developers, other architects), defining customer solutions, and delivering engagements that are innovative and exceed business requirements.
* Work with Marketing, Sales, and Digital Architects to identify growth opportunities and build sales strategies for identified opportunities.
* Proactively build a pipeline of opportunities to support the delivery of territory revenue targets.
* Maximize D365 Ongoing Support & Services delivery value to clients through regular reviews of utilization, working with clients, consultants, and scrum master’s to shape backlogs and ensure alignment to client success.
* Keep your team updated on exciting LVS news such as wins, growth, new branches, company direction and strategic sessions.
* Act as an escalation point for matters related to our offerings and lead or assist in the development of resolution plans as required.
* Provide direction and assistance to team members on how to deal with situations and issues on their own.

### **What You Bring:**

* 10+ years of industry experience working with Dynamics 365 F&O
* 5+ years of experience with Agile/Scrum
* Proven skills and background with Dynamics 365 F&O presales and demos
* Ability to effectively communicate to different audiences including internal and external stakeholders and peers clearly and concisely in written, oral and various presentation formats and situations.
* Proficiency in workshop facilitation (envisioning workshops, art-of-the-possible sessions.
* Self-motivation and drive, always looking for ways to improve skills and stay relevant in given area of expertise.

### **What Makes You Extra Awesome:**

* Post-secondary education
* Industry certifications such as Dynamics FastTrack, Microsoft MVP, Enterprise Architecture (TOGAF, Zachman), and relevant Azure experience across IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS solutions

### **Why Work at Long View?**

* **Great people and culture**
* **Fun is one of our cores values.**
* **Interesting work** – Be part of exciting projects while accessing all the latest technologies.
* **Flexible environment** – A workplace that values the importance of flexibility for personal/professional growth, happiness, and wellness.

**Want to learn more about our culture and life at Long View? Check us out on LinkedIn, Twitter and Instagram!** **Long View’s mission of building the best and most sustainable team-driven organization requires dedicated and ambitious people. Through employee resource groups, impactful and effective conversations, townhalls and various company-wide training, including how to reduce unconscious bias, we are fostering an inclusive environment. We are committed to taking consistent, positive and lifelong action to be a diverse and equitable workplace because we know that the most effective companies are made up of people with varied identities, experiences and backgrounds.**  

Long View is an equal opportunity employer. If you have any accommodation requests for your interview or the role, please let your friendly Recruiter know.

title: Solutions Architect III, Life Cycle Services, Store & Branch Roll Out
description:
About Zones


Zones is a global provider of end-to-end IT solutions with an unmatched supply chain. Positioned to be the IT partner you need, Zones, a Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) in business for over 35 years, specializes in Digital Workplace, Cloud & Data Center, Networking, Security, and Managed/Professional/Staﬃng services. Operating in more than 120 countries, leveraging a robust portfolio, and utilizing the highest certiﬁcation levels from key partners, including Microsoft, Apple, Cisco, Lenovo, Adobe, and more, Zones has mastered the science of building digital infrastructures that change the way modern organizations do business. Whatever you need, you can Consider IT Done.

**Position Overview**

As the Solutions Architect III, Store & Branch Roll Out, your focus is to lead technical presales efforts focused on creating end-to-end solutions and services for multi-branch enterprises in the Retail, Banking, Public Sector and Healthcare industries. This could include IT infrastructure systems, Logistics, Integrations, Software and Hardware product lines, and the services related to them (field deployments and lifecycle services). In addition to leading in the presales efforts, you will be responsible for consulting engagements in the most complex environments to ensure optimal implementation of the complex design for Zones Logistics & Integrations offerings. This is an excellent opportunity to take your career to the next level and make an impact on Zones global growth for 2024!

What you will be doing:

 Creating Digital Workplace Offerings aligned to Store & Branch roll outs in the following key areas:* **Professional services**: Assessment services, IMAC/D, Smart Hands, POC/Pilot services, consulting services, Field Deployment services
* **Procurement Services:** Procurement Planning & Execution, Procurement Planning & Execution, Order Processing

**Configuration Services:**
* Leading Solutioning and Sales effort, including working as part of the Solution Development team to create responses to customer RFPs and technical solution components of SOW.
* Being the solutioning subject matter expert for products and services related to new site installation, moves, adds, changes and disposal (including dispatch, ticketing, project lifecycle) especially within the retail domain.
* Working with field services partners for solutions and pricing
* Having an eye for detail and competitive intelligence in ensuring that effort estimation, pricing, scope, and assumptions strike the right balance between the ability to win it as well as the ability to deliver it
* Creating competitive proposals that reflect thought leadership and alternate creative options

**We are seeking candidates with the following experience and skills:*** 10+ years of experience in a Solution Engineering/Architecture role in retail, healthcare, public sector, or banking focusing on multi-branch IT solutions
* 7+ years strategic solutioning, pricing and contract negotiation via Solutioning roles
* Experience working with proposal teams in a dynamic, fast-paced environment supporting critical business development activities
* Ability to strategize, plan and execute writing requirements for all proposals, responses etc.
* Entrepreneur spirit with smart leadership qualities, ownership and accountability.
* Excellent analytical and communication skills, strong customer service skills.
* Ability to thrive in a fast paced, unstructured, limited governance dynamic environment without losing focus on results.
* Analytical/critical-thinking skills for understanding complex product offerings, value propositions, and defining them in succinct, persuasive written responses.
* Ability to mentor and constructively guide business units and provide articulate consultation on departmental procedures, best practices, and strategic responses.
* Demonstrated leadership skills as evidenced by initiative, mentorship, collaboration, big-picture thinking.
* Focused on client business outcomes and challenges.
* Focused on quality deliverable development.



#LI-LM1


#LI-Remote


Zones offers a comprehensive Benefits package  

  

While we’re committed to providing top-tier solutions, we’re just as committed to supporting our own team. Our employees enjoy a variety of comprehensive benefits, including medical/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, a 401(k) plan with matching provision, paid time off, and much more. And as a Minority Business Enterprise, a Corporate Plus member of the Northwest Minority Supplier Development Council, and an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer, our community is just as diverse.  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status or on the basis of disability.  

  

At Zones, work is more than a job –with exciting careers with a global team who are client centric, have a passion for tech, who embrace change and lifelong learning in a collaborative culture. If you’re interested in working on the cutting edge of IT innovation, sales, engineering, operations, administration, and more, Zones is the place for you!

title: Technical Pre-Sales Support / Customer Success Engineer
description:
ClickHouse is the hottest analytic database on the planet. It now has more contributors than ElasticSearch, previously the biggest open-source analytic project on GitHub. We’re looking to hire even more. Altinity is a distributed company that values employees, open-source, and doing the right things for customers.

We are looking to hire a strong database expert who is customer-focused and results-driven for a **Pre-Sales Technical Support / Customer Success Engineer** role. Have you delivered enterprise systems in production environments? Do you have hands-on experience in databases and cloud technology? Are you able to project manage complex deployments with distributed teams? Come talk to us about how you can evangelize open-source ClickHouse technology and help our customers deploy real-time analytic apps successfully.

Our ideal candidate should have experience working with open-source technology

**Responsibilities:**

* Experience with ClickHouse is a MUST
* SQL knowledge for one of: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server.
* Support our sales team during the customer trial process: demos, presentations, and solution tailoring by ingesting customers’ data and working on it with SQL
* Manage communications between the customer and various internal Altinity Teams
* Manage and prioritize multiple parallel sales engagements with touch points in Engineering, Security, and Legal.
* Engage new and existing accounts to identify and build relationships with decision-makers.
* Ensure 100% customer satisfaction across assigned sets of accounts (no less than 40).
* Prioritize customer needs and coordinate with support, product, and engineering teams to help customers be successful with ClickHouse and our Managed Database offering (Altinity.Cloud).
* Create technical documentation for DevOps, implementations, and service engagements

**Requirements:**

* 5+ years experience in Database engineer / systems architect / sales engineer roles working for companies in SaaS, Open Source, or Enterprise Software.
* Extensive experience in leading, tracking, and managing projects
* Project management skills (organizing meetings, gathering customer requirements, writing Minutes of Meetings) and ability to communicate status clearly both to customers as well as internal teams
* Successful customer-facing technical sales experience
* Experience in managing B2B relations with a track record of steadily increasing responsibility in sales or customer growth
* Strong technical knowledge, understanding, and passion for Databases, SQL, and high-tech
* Hands-on experience with DevOps tools
* Solid understanding of cloud computing trends and open-source business models
* Familiar with programming languages.
* Strong analytical, numerical, and presentation skills
* Ability to develop and use solution-based, consultative sales techniques
* Experience in leading a discussion with a group of Product Managers, Engineers, and Executives
* Enthusiasm for working in a high-profile, fast-paced startup culture.
* Ready to travel for business when necessary
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills (in English and Russian)

**Our Benefits:**

* Work from Anywhere, Anytime: We are not your typical nine-to-five shop! Enjoy the flexibility of working from literally wherever and whenever. Create a schedule that works for you and your family or lifestyle. Recharge your batteries with our open vacation policies.
* Cultural Diversity: We love that we get to work with passionate people from around the world. Currently, our team is made of professionals from 12 different countries!
* Career Development: We provide opportunities to learn new technologies as well as try out new roles. We also offer access to training on leading-edge technologies, plus flexible work schedules for external education.
* USA Employees Benefits: We offer comprehensive PPO health care plans for our US-based employees that are incredibly flexible to meet the needs of individuals or families. 401K with company match also available.
* Company Travel: We come together in person two to three times per year in locations across the globe. During non-pandemic times, of course! We also fund travel to conferences and encourage presentations as well as contributions to open-source communities.

This is a full-time position and includes equity in the company. Some travel will be required  
Altinity is venture-funded and financially stable.  
We are 100% remote. You may work anywhere you have work permits, though you will have to cater to the North American market.

Check out our many other benefits including flexible work hours, career development, and open vacation policies.

To apply, send your resume and a short description of why you would like to join Altinity or work with ClickHouse to applynow@altinity.com

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $80,000.00 - $110,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have hands-on experience in databases and cloud technology?
* Do you have any experience or knowledge of ClickHouse?
* Do you have LinkedIn and GitHub profiles? Please share the links if you do

Experience:

* hands-on in databases and cloud technology: 2 years (Required)
* Technical sales: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Solution Engineer Partners
description:
We believe most, if not all, human-to-machine interactions can be automated for the greater good of our customers and their employees. Most, if not all, digital experiences today will eventually manifest as conversational interactions and truly transform the way enterprises interact with their key stakeholders: customers, partners, and employees. We also believe that we play a critical role in making these interactions simple, natural, and efficient by harnessing the power of automation.



We, at Kore.ai, achieve this with unsurpassed innovation in **Natural Language Processing** (NLP) to deliver the next generation virtual assistant creation platform, experience delivery platforms, and vertical and horizontal industry-specific solutions.



At **Kore.ai,** you will enjoy success, develop your professional skills and allow your career to thrive within a fast-growing business that is expanding its global team.



In this role you will be responsible for developing and managing our partners’ ecosystem of advisory, system integrators, technology partners, and the network of resellers and ISVs. We aspire to grow revenue and build a long-term profitable business with our most valuable partners at the strategic level.


**POSITION / TITLE: SOLUTION ENGINEER PARTNERS**



As a Solutions Engineer Partners, you’ll be expected to promote knowledge-building and skills enhancement for Kore.ai Partner organizations. Be instrumental in managing & facilitating webinars, delivering compelling technical presentations in an understandable language to target audience especially during the initial stages of partner engagement. Leading and providing expertise during technical onboarding processes, ensuring our partner’s Solution Engineers and demo team have a seamless introduction to our technology and product suites. By executing these responsibilities, you will play a key role in enhancing our partner relationships and amplifying our product reach. To excel in this role, a solid understanding of technical aspects, excellent communication skills, and a keen sense of customer service are essential.


**LOCATION: REMOTE, EMEA**


**RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Demonstrate Kore.ai Product Suite, product features and pre-build solutions.
* Develop acute familiarity and mastery of the Kore product suite, and effectively guide partners through product and use-case demonstrations.
* Articulate our unique value proposition and technology differentiation.
* Whiteboard the solution and review architecture, performance, and scalability requirements.
* Foster strong technical collaborations with both internal teams (technical architects, NLU analysts, etc) and external partners in developing robust and effective solution designs and product demonstrations.
* Provide adept RFI / RFP support, assisting in responses that showcase the technical strengths and capabilities of our products.
* The role involves creating engaging content, including thorough documentation like PPTs and videos representing product features & functionalities and use-case demonstrations.
* Offer SME (Subject Matter Expert) support to the product development and implementation team, creating Jira tickets and following up with the Product & Engineering team to resolve technical issues.
* Represent our company in industry events and partner conferences, showcasing our technical capabilities, facilitating & driving use cases workshops to a wider audience.
* Engage in solution discovery and blueprinting activities to unearth innovative ways to tackle business challenges.
* Guide partners in understanding EO estimates, ensuring clarity, and accuracy in our dealings.


**EXPERIENCE / SKILLS REQUIRED**


**MUST HAVE SKILLS**


* Minimum 5 years of experience in a client-facing sales engineer/presales/solution architect technical role required
* Previous experience in contact center technologies (CCAAS, IVR, ITR, Chatbots, Conversational AI) is required
* Minimum 5 years of experience participating in the sales cycle at a technology company required
* Technical experience preferably sales-engineering &/or web-development experience required
* Strong technical acumen & ability to learn new patterns, spaces and domains quickly required
* Ability to understand our client’s challenging business problems and frame up a crisp solution required
* Experience with languages such as Python, Node.js, JavaScript, and Linux shell scripts is preferred
* Excellent communication skills need to articulate technical capabilities to business users and business requirements to technology team/s


**OTHER SKILLS:**


* Confidence and strong presentation skills to drive large portions of long customer meetings.
* Strong customer presence, especially with senior client executives.
* Approachable and someone who loves to work a room and build relationships.
* A consultant mindset to identify and frame customer solutions
* Proven track record selling partner deals.
* Exceptional listener.
* A whatever it takes attitude, willing to put in the extra effort when needed (long hours & travel).
* Experience with NLU technology in the industry.
* Strong verbal and written communication.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
* Highly organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated.
* Able to thrive in a high-growth, fast-paced environment.


**EDUCATION QUALIFICATION**


* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related quantitative field required.

  
##### **We’re always looking for talented and passionate people. Get in touch! Send in your CV to** **careers\\_us\\_emea\\_latam@kore.ai**

title: JSEC Client Account and Solutions Director - REMOTE
description:
**Your Impact:**  

Within the Divergent Solutions (DVS) line of business, our Platforms, Technologies & Software Solutions (PT&SS) business focuses on revolutionizing next generation solutions with technologies, platforms, and software enabled services. This position will help supercharge growth for the Jacobs Software Engineering Center (JSEC) in Hudson, New Hampshire, a critical area of PT&SS.


JSEC is searching for the right person to expand our business development and capture efforts in direct support of growth targets. This is a unique opportunity to define and build the sales capability for a dynamic software organization working within the Department of Defense’s (DoD) enterprise.


As the growth and sales lead for the JSEC organization, this position will also work closely and directly with the Jacobs Divergent Solutions Growth and Sales organization to coordinate and collaborate on strategies and opportunities to grow the business globally.

  

**Responsibilities:**


* Develop growth strategies that build off core strengths of JSEC
* Identify prospective new software development work and opportunity in logical, adjacent industry spaces
* Build strong personal relationships with current and prospective customers
* Develop plans for securing knowledge and understanding of the customer’s requirements, software development strategies, capabilities, issues, and needs
* Lead planning sessions with core team
* Coordinate meetings with customers, competitors, clients, and teammates to develop market insight on requirements, acquisition strategy, acquisition timing, and contract vehicle choices
* Plan and lead capture activities, to include opportunity gate reviews, collaboration and workshop sessions, proposal reviews
* Work within the foundation of the Jacobs Divergent Solutions capture planning process and practices
* Brief capture status at specified milestones in the capture process, when material changes occur and as needed
* Mentor program managers in the capture management process
* Develop capture budgets and execute capture plans within those approved budgets  

Support other business development activities as assigned

**Here’s What You’ll Need:**  

* Active Top Secret security clearance
* Bachelor’s Degree (technical discipline preferred)
* 10+ years of overall relevant project delivery, program management, sales, and business development experience
* 5+ years demonstrated experience developing, building, and growing business in the DoD space with direct knowledge of and experience with the Air Force, Space Force, and/or TRANSCOM
* 5+ years experience in software-based business development
* Leadership skills to develop, organize and execute significant capture activities, including building industry teams, assessing win probability, and executing customer call plans to shape acquisitions, in order to respond to and win business with new and existing customers
* A proven track record of successful capture management in Department of Defense (particularly USAF, Navy & Army) software markets across organizations
* Experience leading teams in a virtual environment; ability to work through others, and get results from teams that do not report directly to you
* Must be able to secure and maintain a security clearance.
* Must be able to read and write effectively in English.
* Must embrace Beyond Zero/Safety principles of Jacobs to include; adhering to safe work practices and standards while performing daily tasks, taking responsibility for own and coworkers’ safekeeping and encouraging others to work safely.
* With the exception of STD/LTD/FMLA & approved time off, attendance is considered essential.
* Must be able to work within the shift hours of 7:00am and 5:00pm.
* Physical requirements – Work is primarily sedentary. Some walking and standing may occur in the course of a normal workday in connection with travel to and from meeting and conferences. May carry light items, such as reports, data products, and notebooks.
* Willingness to travel to other U.S. cities to support customer visits and strategy workshops.
* Estimated travel up to 25% annually as required
  

  

**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Financial experience to understand pricing and other quantitative complexities in large bids
* Completed professional training in Capture Management
* Active TS/SCI security clearance
  

  

Jacobs’ health and welfare benefits are designed to invest in you and in the things you care about. Your health. Your well-being. Your security. Your future. Eligible employees and their dependents may elect medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan, and, if eligible, a deferred compensation plan and Executive Deferral Plan. Employees will also receive 17 days of vacation per year, seven paid holidays, plus floating holidays and caregiver leave. Hired applicants will be able to purchase company stock and have the opportunity to receive a performance discretionary bonus.


The base salary range for this position is $190,000 to $230,000. This range reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.

title: Business Development Lead – Azure - Digital Velocity
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and enthusiastic Business Development Lead (BDL) – Azure to join our team. In this role, you will play a vital role in selling Azure cloud consumption, managed services, cloud marketplace solutions, and professional services to our clients. This is an excellent opportunity for individuals who are passionate about cloud technology and want to make an impact!



Key Areas of Responsibility


* Manage inbound opportunity qualification and triage
* Assist in account mapping with strategic OEMs
* Assist in account planning with CDW Sellers
* Understanding and delivery of the DV pitch and value proposition to CDW sellers, OEMs and suppliers.
* Project Kick off and Close out follow up to generate additional opportunities within buying customers
* Demonstrate good teamwork with coworkers
* Supplier Management and opportunity generation
* Pipeline management
* Assist DS team in exceeding category revenue and profit goal consistently while attaining high customer satisfaction.




Education and/or Skill-Set Qualifications


* Bachelor’s Degree
* 2 years of experience working in a Azure or cloud technology sales role


Qualifications:


* Strong passion for technology and cloud computing, particularly Azure services.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships with clients.
* Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, target-driven sales environment.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to understand and articulate complex technical concepts.
* Experience in consultative sales, solution selling, and value-based selling methodologies.
* Azure certification(s) such as Azure Certified Solutions Architect, Azure Certified Cloud Practitioner, or Azure Certified Sales Specialist is a plus.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team, collaborating with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Familiarity with sales and CRM tools, such as Salesforce is a plus.

title: SAP Basis Consultant (Digital Customer Engagement) - 5171033
description:
**Accenture Flex** offers you the flexibility of local fixed-duration project-based work powered by Accenture, a leading global professional services company. Accenture is consistently recognized on FORTUNE's 100 Best Companies to Work For and Diversity Inc's Top 50 Companies For Diversity lists.


As an **Accenture Flex** employee, you will apply your skills and experience to help drive business transformation for leading organizations and communities. In addition to delivering innovative solutions for Accenture's clients, you will work with a highly skilled, diverse network of people across Accenture businesses who are using the latest emerging technologies to address today's biggest business challenges.


You will receive competitive rewards and access to benefits programs and world-class learning resources. **Accenture Flex** employees work in their local metro area onsite at the project, significantly reducing and/or eliminating the demands to travel.

**Job Description**

* Supports sales to delivery handover and customer onboarding to SAP Enterprise Cloud Services
* Initiates digital service kick off for customers
* Ensures periodic service reviews to track the service quality across a range of customers
* Contributes to onboarding transitioning customers to SAP ENTERPRISE CLOUD SERVICES
* Orchestrates the overall service project delivery according to planned scope, budget, and milestones
* Supports in de escalations of critical customer situations
* Supports critical customer situations in conjunction with Major Incident Management MIM , SAP Enterprise Cloud Services Customer Office teams and SAP Product Support, as applicable activities
* Customer Engagement Manager is expected to manage customers.
* Please note that this role focuses more on the customer side rather than technical.

  

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Minimum 3 years as a SAP technical consultant
* Minimum 3 years of exp in customer facing role consulting, IT support and IT services
* Minimum 3 years of experience in SAP Basis
* Minimum 3 years of experience in SAP Cloud experience.
* High School Diploma or GED

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in engineering
* SAP Basis, SAP Cloud and client communication
* Strong knowledge of IT Service Management, SAP Basis and SAP Applications
* Hands-on experience with SAP Basis activities, SAP release version upgrades and infrastructure updates for cloud customers
* Working experience with SAP HEC, SAP S/4HANA or any other cloud solution.
* Hands-on experience with infrastructure operations, network, interfaces and Load Balancer topics
* Strong technical troubleshooting skills with the ability to form the big picture quickly before surmising a path to a solution.
* Excellent English communication skills with customer facing experience.

*Compensation at Accenture varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the specific office location, role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in**California, Colorado, New York or Washington as set forth below. We accept applications on an on-going basis and there is no fixed deadline to apply.*

*Information on benefits is here.*


Role Location

*California: $54.80 to $64.80/hour*

*Colorado: $54.80 to $64.80/hour*

*New York: $54.80 to $64.80/hour*

*Washington: $54.80 to $64.80/hour*

 ***What We Believe***

 *We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment.*

 *Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities.* *Read more here*
