title: Senior Solution Architect, Google Cloud Platform - Remote
description:
Are you passionate about cloud technology and looking for a challenging role that will advance your career to the next level? If yes, we have an exciting opportunity for you! We are currently searching for a **Senior Solution Architect - Google Cloud Platform** to join our innovative team.
  

  

In this influential position, you will leverage your expertise to build and deploy dynamic solutions, shaping the future of our company's technology landscape. Collaborating with insightful consultants and bright developers, you'll architect and design state-of-the-art cloud solutions that will revolutionize our business operations. This is a unique chance to unleash your creativity, work with cutting-edge technology, and lead our digital transformation journey. If you're ready to take your career to new heights in a supportive and forward-thinking environment, apply today!!  

  

Req.#571689507  

  

RESPONSIBILITIES* Act as SME in the design and development of cloud-based solutions based on GCP
* Play a pivotal role in the planning, design, and deployment of cloud solutions with an emphasis on Google Cloud tools and technologies
* Maintain target billable utilization for client work
* Actively participate in and support the EPAM's GCP presales efforts, including preparation & delivery of client discovery, proposals, presentations, technical workshops, etc
* Collaborate with multiple cross-functional teams to understand technical & business requirements, propose options/alternative approaches, perform relevant analysis and recommendations
* Act as SME to those managing, optimizing, and administering Google Cloud Platform infrastructure
* Work closely with the sales team to assess, define, and deliver the GCP technical outcomes/solutions to our clients
* Support billable client projects by providing hands-on technical expertise/assistance/support and meeting client project deliverables

  

REQUIREMENTS* Strong highly fluent, eloquent, and clear spoken and written communication, conversation, and collaboration skills
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field is required. Google PCA certification is expected. Software engineering background/experience is expected. Additional GCP Professional certifications are expected for strong candidates. AWS/Azure certifications and/or experience are a bonus
* Terraform-on-GCP fluency, proficiency, and hands-on experience are a bonus
* Proven experience as a GCP Cloud Architect with GCP-infrastructure setup & core building blocks (VPC architectures, Networking/subnetting/firewalls, Cloud-NAT, PGA/PSA/PSC), load-balancers, interconnect, VPN, IAP, security)
* Proven experience as a GCP Cloud Architect with strong knowledge of GCP services like Spanner, Cloud Run, BigQuery/BigLake/Spark/Dataflow, Composer/Airflow, GKE, Pub/Sub, Kafka, Bigtable, Firestore, and VertexAI
* Experience in vendor liaison, presales, client-facing roles, consulting roles, or account management roles preferred
* Excellent understanding of distributed systems, databases, and distributed-system design patterns & tradeoffs
* Ability to multitask and prioritize work based on multiple ongoing activities/requirements
* Excellent problem-solving skills

  

BENEFITS* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance (Subsidized)
* Health Savings Account
* Flexible Spending Accounts (Healthcare, Dependent Care, Commuter)
* Short-Term and Long-Term Disability (Company Provided)
* Life and AD&D Insurance (Company Provided)
* Employee Assistance Program
* Unlimited access to LinkedIn learning solutions
* Matched 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan
* Paid Time Off – the employee will be eligible to accrue 15-25 paid days, depending on specific level and tenure with EPAM (accrual eligibility may change over time)
* Paid Holidays - nine (9) total per year
* Legal Plan and Identity Theft Protection
* Accident Insurance
* Employee Discounts
* Pet Insurance
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* If otherwise eligible, participation in the discretionary annual bonus program
* If otherwise eligible and hired into a qualifying level, participation in the discretionary Long-Term Incentive (LTI) Program

  

ABOUT EPAM* EPAM is a leading global provider of digital platform engineering and development services. We are committed to having a positive impact on our customers, our employees, and our communities. We embrace a dynamic and inclusive culture. Here you will collaborate with multi-national teams, contribute to a myriad of innovative projects that deliver the most creative and cutting-edge solutions, and have an opportunity to continuously learn and grow. No matter where you are located, you will join a dedicated, creative, and diverse community that will help you discover your fullest potential

  

ADDITIONAL* This posting includes a good faith range of the salary EPAM would reasonably expect to pay the selected candidate. The range provided reflects base salary only. Individual compensation offers within the range are based on a variety of factors, including, but not limited to: geographic location, experience, credentials, education, training; the demand for the role; and overall business and labor market considerations. Most candidates are hired at a salary within the range disclosed. Salary range: $119k– $190k. In addition, the details highlighted in this job posting above are a general description of all other expected benefits and compensation for the position
* Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis

title: National Security Services Solution Architect – Program Strategy, CyberSecurity, Risk
description:
CDW delivers a unified approach to addressing data risk through a unique combination of consulting service offerings. CDW – Integrated Security delivers a unified approach to addressing data risk through a unique combination of service offerings. CDW has brought together industry-leading expertise in cyber security, identity governance and access management, data privacy and analytics, internal audit, and hands-on training services, giving companies everything needed to plan and develop effective risk and security programs. By integrating these services, we provide our clients with the flexible support they need to protect and leverage data across any part of their organization. Simply put, CDW is the next generation of risk management.



The National Security Services Solution Architect (S3A) is a field-based technical pre-sales role supporting CDW’s Program Strategy, CyberSecurity, Compliance, and Risk practices:


* Compliance Consulting: PCI-DSS, SWIFT, Data Privacy (GLBA, CPRA, GDPR, etc), HIPAA, CMMC Security Strategy and Program Transformation: Security controls assessments, security program consulting


* Risk Consulting: SOX, FTC Compliance, internal audit,



This role involves providing consultative guidance, scoping service offerings, and fostering strategic relationships to drive business growth. In this role you will be working with customers, delivery, internal sales, marketing and events teams to develop and maintain strategic relationships and be a trusted advisor to grow our Security services business.



Key Responsibilities:


* Scope and draft appropriate assessment and service solutions for CDW customers, including security and privacy assessments, security and privacy compliance consulting, as well as advisory, risk, and vCISO services.
* Collaborate with customers, delivery teams, and internal sales to offer consultative guidance, plan sales strategy, and author statements of work (SOWs).
* Analyze administrative, budgetary, technical, regulatory, and competitive considerations, defining actions to meet customer expectations in the sales cycle.
* Maintain strategic relationships with Sales & Delivery management, acting as a trusted advisor to drive business growth.
* Act as a subject matter expert in multiple families of professional security and privacy services.
* Drive outreach initiatives, professional service enablement projects, coaching, and mentoring for other security S3As as well as presales peers in sister practices for cross collaboration.
* Uncover strategic and emerging business opportunities in collaboration with presales peers, delivery, sales, partners, and customers.




Required Qualifications:


* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
* Minimum of five years in technical or professional services pre-sales or post-sale delivery.
* Motivated, self-starting, and able to independently perform high quality work with minimal guidance.
* Highly Proficient in Microsoft Office applications.
* Industry knowledge and domain expertise: An S3A should possess domain expertise. They should understand industry-specific challenges, regulations, and best practices. This knowledge enables them to provide tailored recommendations and position the company's solutions effectively within the industry landscape. Specific areas of subject matter expertise include, but are not limited to the following:
+ PCI-DSS, SWIFT
+ GDPR, CPRA, GLBA, CMMC, HIPAA, HITRUST, Third Party Risk
+ SOX, FTC Safeguards rule, SEC
+ Previous engineering/delivery experience in any of these fields is a strong plus
* Team collaboration and leadership: Collaboration with cross-functional teams, including sales and delivery, is crucial in this role. A S3A should be able to work effectively in a team, lead technical discussions, and influence decision-making. They may also provide guidance and mentorship to junior team members.


* Customer-focused approach: An S3A must have a customer-centric mindset and be able to understand and articulate customer needs effectively. They should possess excellent communication and presentation skills, to every vertical, to engage with customers, gather requirements, and explain technical concepts in a clear and concise manner. Building relationships, understanding customer pain points, and providing tailored solutions are key aspects of this role.
* Sales acumen: While not strictly a sales role, a pre-sales solution architect needs to have a strong business and sales acumen. They should understand the sales process, collaborate closely with sales teams, and contribute to sales strategies. The ability to effectively communicate the value proposition of solutions, understand pricing models, and create compelling proposals and statements of work (SOWs) is important.
* Proven Multi Project management skills: The successful applicant will need to effectively manage multiple projects, meet deadlines,. Being able to manage customer priorities, work in a fast-paced environment, and adapt to changing requirements is essential.
* Solution design and problem-solving skills: The candidate should have the ability to design comprehensive solutions that address customer requirements and business challenges. They should be skilled in analyzing complex problems, identifying appropriate solutions, and translating various concepts into understandable terms for customers. Strong problem-solving skills are crucial for identifying and resolving issues or gaps in proposed solutions.
* Continuous learning and adaptability: Technology is constantly evolving, so a pre-sales solution architect should have a passion for learning and staying updated with industry trends, new technologies, and emerging solutions. Adaptability to changing customer needs and the ability to quickly grasp and apply new concepts are important qualities for success in this role.
* Willingness to travel up to 25% or as needed.

title: Sr. Applications Engineer
description:
Amida Technology Solutions is a DC-based technology company focused on solutions for data interoperability, data utility, and data security. We create open-source solutions that collect, reconcile, transform, and standardize data for business intelligence, predictive analytics, decision support, and user transactions. We specialize in taking data from inception to impact.

Our team is comprised of creative, forward thinkers who are passionate about using cutting-edge technology to make a difference in people's lives and have a positive impact on our country. We offer an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment that values fresh ideas, candid conversations, and authentic teamwork.

Amida is currently looking for a **Sr. Applications Engineer for Microelectronics Security** to join our team in Washington DC. Amida is seeking an experienced Sr. Applications Engineer for Microelectronics Security to work closely with our customers to help them solve mission-critical security challenges in their leading-edge semiconductor designs.

This role will be responsible for pre-/post-sales support, ranging from initial design and implementation for new customers, to expansion of an existing customer footprint to new sites and to new solution functionality. You will be joining a dynamic team focused on the development and deployment of innovative security products for the global semiconductor industry. Part consultant and part product expert, you'll be passionate about guiding our customers to get their Amida software up and running quickly and delivering value.

**What You Will Do:**

* Enable customer success through the design and deployment of Amida's microelectronics security solutions.
* Lead/Assist in coordinating and executing all technical activities throughout the sales opportunity lifecycle such as technical discovery, product presentations, demonstrations, and evaluations.
* Build strong relationships with customers, acting as a trusted advisor by understanding customer requirements, providing technical expertise, answering technical inquiries, and offering recommendations.
* Collaborate with Amida's product development teams to translate customer requirements into exciting new product features.
* Contribute to consulting services; conduct introductory and/or intermediate training classes.
* Document and share best practices to enhance the efficiency of customer onboarding and adoption of Amida's microelectronics security solutions.

**Required Skills:**

* BS in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related field with 5 years' experience, MS with 3 years' experience
* 3+ years of prior experience in front-end SoC design (Verilog/SystemVerilog/VHDL) and functional verification, emulation, simulation, and/or FPGA-based design flows.
* Strong proficiency with standard EDA products for RTL Simulation/Emulation from Cadence, Synopsys, or Siemens(Mentor).
* Able to automate solutions using scripting languages like Python, JavaScript, or similar.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Technical knowledge, consultative skills, and the ability to work effectively and contribute to the extended team.
* Self-motivated, proactive team player with a high level of integrity and desire work collaboratively in a 'start-up' environment - flexibility as the company and role scales.
* Excellent written and verbal communication, listening, and presentation skills.
* Up to 25% domestic travel required.

P**referred Skills:**

* Master's degree
* Experience delivering high-quality support for a large-scale commercial software
* Basic Linux networking skills
* Experience in Cybersecurity analysis and related standards like ISO 21434, DO-356A
* Professional experience in a functional safety environment (ISO26262)

Communication is the key to success at Amida. Our people are known for their can-do attitude and their ability to work effectively with client teams. We pride ourselves on having a collegial, multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds and experience. Our best team members pay intense attention to detail in all aspects of their work, have a strong sense of initiative, and are willing to be opinionated about the best ways of doing things. A sense of humor is an asset at Amida.

We help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you're looking for an opportunity to help important organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.

Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Front-end SoC design (Verilog/SystemVerilog/VHDL): 3 years (Required)
* EDA products for RTL Simulation/Emulation: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: IT Architect, SAP Business Applications (Supply Chain)
description:
Overview:

Shure has embarked on a multi-year, multi phased S4 journey. A green field approach is being taken to this transformational journey. The first two releases of S4 have been successfully implemented – Finance and Procure to Pay (Ariba). The goal is to complete the S4 journey and retire ECC over the next 3 years.

  

The application eco system at Shure includes SAP ECC, SAP S4, Salesforce, ShipERP, Loftware, SAP WM, ITS Mobile, SAP Hybris and many other cutting-edge technologies. Shure is headquartered in Niles, Illinois and has offices in over 26 countries including Germany, Hongkong, Japan, Juarez, China, UK. Shure products are sold in over 100 countries and has two manufacturing facilities (China and Mexico) and multiple distribution centers (3PL and Shure owned) around the globe. The SAP system is used to support all the key business processes including Manufacturing, Order processing and Invoicing, Procurement and Month end reporting.

  

In your role as **SAP S4 HANA IT Architect, Supply Chain** you will play a technical leadership role within the SAP organization in Materials Management (MM), MRP, Logistics Execution (LE), Warehousing (EWM), Purchasing and Trade Compliance. In addition, you will be serving as a primary liaison and strategic business partner with business leadership.

  

This will be a hands-on configurator role with no people management responsibility. You will be responsible for providing the necessary solution expertise to drive the global SAP Supply Chain design and solutioning across ECC and S4. This role will also work with the global business teams and global SAP team to identify opportunities to promote leading industry practices, streamline and drive system driven business process improvements.

  



This position requires exposure to industry best practices and technology trends with the ability and interest to expand across technologies, when required.

 **This role will be hybrid, based in our Niles, IL location.**


Responsibilities:
* Responsible for providing solution expertise, hands-on solution design, performing solution build/configuration, build test cases, test execution and implementing integrated end to end solutions
* Responsible for providing solution design in the supply chain area including Materials Management (MM), MRP, Logistics Execution (LE), Warehousing (EWM) and Ariba procurement platforms and related deliverables for large, transformational, global projects.
* Collaborate and communicate with business stakeholders, understand business requirements, provide deep SAP Functional expertise in the related process areas (SAP MM, SAP LE, Trade Compliance, SAP EWM, Ariba), demonstrate knowledge of key integration points, perform fit / gap analysis, proto-type and frame up solution design options for decision making
* Examines and evaluates existing business processes as well as key challenges/ opportunities within the key process area identified above
* Work closely with the SAP analysts to perform the necessary design reviews, and deliver quality solutions within time and budget
* Continually review evolving SAP technologies within SAP MM, SAP LE, EWM, Ariba and assess potential impact, and propose innovative solutions and/or enhancements to existing business processes.
* Collaborate and support the SAP Team located in US and Asia time zone during development, testing and implementation
* Understand the data & analytical platform capabilities and support the implementation of the new platform during blueprint, testing and go live; Support the newly established Data Governance processes
* Ensure solution design proposal adhere to the established security and data standards.
* Participate and support all phases of the project including planning, blueprint, solutioning, development, testing and support as needed


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in related field. Graduate coursework is desirable.
* Minimum of 8 years working experience with a heavy focus on SAP supply chain solutions and at least 4 years of experience on large, transformational initiatives in a fast paced, complex environment
* Experience providing solution and driving large, global, transformational initiatives.
* Knowledge and integration experience handling 2 ERP systems (SAP-ECC, SAP S4), Business Intelligence, Data platform, Third party tools like ShipERP, Trade compliance tools, etc...
* Demonstrated ability to work on complex issues of diverse scope where analysis of situations or data requires evaluation of a variety of factors, including an understanding of current business trends.
* Process-oriented with high attention to detail in exercising experience-based judgement to determine appropriate methods and actions.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentation skills
* Excellent problem solving and root cause analysis skills.
* Able to quickly learn new concepts and technology
* Able to follow processes and operational policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.


#LI-Remote
IND123 **WHO WE ARE**  

Shure’s mission is to be the most trusted audio brand worldwide – and for nearly a century, our Core Values have aligned us to be just that. Founded in 1925, we are a leading global manufacturer of audio equipment known for quality, reliability, and durability. We engineer microphones, headphones, wireless audio systems, conferencing systems, and more. And quality doesn’t stop at our products. Our talented teams strive for perfection and innovate every chance they get. We offer an Associate-first culture, flexible work arrangements, and opportunity for all.  

Shure Incorporated is headquartered in Niles, Illinois, with remote and hybrid opportunities throughout the United States. We have more than 35 regional sales offices, engineering hubs, and manufacturing facilities throughout the Americas, EMEA, and Asia. **THE MIX MATTERS**  

Don’t check off every box in the job requirements? No problem! We recognize that every professional journey is unique and are committed to providing an equitable candidate experience for all prospective Shure Associates. If you’re excited about this role, believe you’ve got the skills to be successful, and share our passion for creating an inclusive, diverse, equitable, and accessible work environment, then apply! **WE GOT YOU - Our Benefits**  

At Shure, we prioritize the well-being of our associates. We offer competitive rewards packages that address physical, mental, financial, and overall well-being. Our benefits include retirement savings plans, generous paid time off programs, employee discounts, professional development opportunities, work-life balance initiatives, employee recognition programs, commuter benefits, employee assistance programs, and volunteering/community involvement opportunities. To learn more, visit our careers page at www.shure.com/careers

title: Solution Architect, D365 Sales (CRM/CE)
description:
Columbus is looking for a Solution Architect, D365 Sales (CRM/CE) to join our growing team. In this position you will collaborate with internal team members and key client stakeholders during all phases of project delivery. The Solution Architect will contribute to pre-sales activities including client/prospect meetings and project estimation, conceptual and functional designs.


Focusing on the Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement platform, this individual will play a critical technical/functional role in a variety of D365 CE projects that include:


* D365 CE Deployment Planning
* D365 CE Implementations
* Customization/Configuration
* System Integration Design
* Data Migration Planning/Design
* Power Platform Development


This is a customer-facing role that requires strong communication and problem-solving skills and the ability to thrive in a team environment. Members of the Columbus delivery team are detail-oriented, able to multi-task and are extremely focused on customer success. The ability to prioritize multiple demands and collaborate effectively in a remote setting is essential.


Note: This is a remote opportunity and can be located from anywhere in the United States. #LI-Remote.


**Responsibilities:**


* Drive discovery workshops with prospects and customers to demonstrate product capabilities and gather business requirements.
* Lead and participate in discovery analysis meetings with customers to understand current business processes.
* Serve as advocate for adherence to standards and best practice.
* Collaborate with sales team and project managers to define the roadmap and milestones for each project.
* On all assigned engagements the Solution Architect should own the proposed solution, work closely with all team members and remain engaged with the client.
* Understand the capabilities of the delivery team and provide design guidance and support as needed.
* Work with customers and internal teams on infrastructure architecture support.
* Provide and/or develop detailed design specifications.
* Exhibit excellent verbal and written communication skills; with flexibility to work in a fast-paced, process-oriented environment.
* Implement and configure Dynamics CRM/CE per customer requirements.
* Assist in software upgrades, including importing data, configuring forms and designing dashboards.
* Design and write workflows to streamline business processes.
* Write process documentation, user acceptance testing scripts and user manuals.
* Test software, communicate with (and sometimes manage) offshore development staff.
* Train and support CRM end users.


**Requirements**:


* 5+ years of professional experience within a consultancy environment with proven Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM experience.
* 5+ years of experience as a consultant or solution architect with Dynamics 365 CRM.
* 3+ years of pre-sales experience.
* A minimum of 5 completed full implementations of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM.
* Extensive knowledge and understanding of the technical side of Dynamics 365 CE solutions.
* In-depth knowledge of the following modules: Sales, Service, Marketing, Social Engagement, USD, PSA, Field Service.
* Strong presentation skills leading to sales process.
* Experience estimating projects, writing contracts, Statements of Work and work orders.
* Ability to successfully build relationships with clients at all levels within an organization.
* Advanced knowledge of enterprise software systems and enterprise cloud.
* Knowledge and experience of Enterprise Application Integration and architecture patterns.
* Previous experience using Dual-write is highly desired.
* Willing to travel domestically up to 30%.


**Preferred:**


* Microsoft Certified Professional qualifications
* Experience with additional D365 CE modules (Customer Service, Field Service)
* Experience with industry standard integration tools such as Scribe and eOne


**Full Time Benefits:**


* Columbus offers a competitive benefits package to all full-time employees. This package includes Health, Life, Dental and Vision Insurance, Short- and Long-Term Disability, in addition to, paid vacation, sick leave, holidays, and 401(k).


#Microsoftgoldpartner

title: Current Opening: Business Development Representative REMOTE
description:
ISE is looking to add to our Sales department a mid-level sales professional with established success in selling cybersecurity services to Enterprise, mid-market, and small business across various industries. The primary focus for this role is to position and sell application, cloud, IoT testing services, offerings, and capabilities within a defined set of prospects and select existing customer accounts.

  


**What you’ll do at ISE:**


* Drive new business by generating and qualifying new business prospects.
* Be consultative: educate potential clients on security risk, solutions, and services. Listen to and address customers' needs and concerns.
* Execute and refine a repeatable process for identifying prospects, outreach, continued follow-up, and lead deal execution.
* Research accounts to identify key contacts and provide account intelligence.
* Develop ongoing relationships with key decision makers and build contact pipelines.
* Grow revenue through increased sales commitments year over year consistently.
* Contribute to the development of proposal pricing strategies.
* Meet and/or exceed quota established for quarterly and annual goals as an individual and serve as an example for other team members.
* Keep up to date on industry trends and provide competitive analysis to optimize strategies for growth.
* Advise and partner with leadership on sales prospecting strategy and client engagement plans, as well as marketing strategies to target a specific industry or market.
* Advise on marketing initiatives to help build the brand.
* Act on leads quickly while communicating deadlines and other important information with the ISE team.

  


**What You Bring to the Table:**


* Ability to independently approach unique challenges and devise solutions.
* Enthusiasm and eagerness to break into new accounts in B2B services sales through a variety of cold outreach strategies.
* Motivated by collaborating with others, problem solving with team members and clients, and forming strong business relationships.
* Understanding of how to turn various inbound lead sources into sales qualified leads.
* Leverage onsite events/conferences to build relationships and gather leads.

  


**Must haves:**


* 1-2+ years of relevant experience to B2B outbound sales
* Previous experience using CRM software, email systems, prospecting tools, and general business software

  


**Nice to haves:**


* Experience collaborating or advising on marketing initiatives to generate inbound sales leads
* Certification or degree in security, IT, security, or related field
* Can come to our Baltimore office 1-2x/week to collaborate and hang with the team or resides in the Los Angeles area
* Knowledge of information security concepts with a continued willingness to learn and grow
* Strong experience selling cybersecurity services in one or more of these industries:
+ Media and entertainment
+ Medical devices/healthcare systems
+ Tech companies, including start ups
+ Software companies
+ Manufacturing

  




**Salary:**


* Base Salary Range: $50K-$90K, according to experience
* Commission Plan: To Be Determined but uncapped

  


**If you don't think you meet all the criteria above but are still interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.**

  



Since titles can impact your career path, we are flexible on this one.

  


**What we bring to the table:**


* Check out joinise.io for full details
* Work that matters; projects that impact people’s everyday life and wellbeing
* Quality, integrity, dedication, and education: our core values
* Life balance: flexible schedule, work from home options, unlimited vacation
* $0 health premium plan option, including spouse and family
* Opportunities to research and publish, speak at major security events and conferences
* Leadership and peers that support and mentor you: your growth is our growth, your success is our success
* Relaxed and fun environment: ditch the suit and tie, sit or stand at your desk or find a sofa

  


**How you’ll learn at ISE:**



Everyone has a mentor, or two or three sometimes. We hold you and ourselves accountable for your advancement. You’ll learn directly from your mentor, your colleagues, resources vetted by the team, and at regular firetalk lunches by your peers – oh, and lunch is on us once a week in the office. You also have access to paid training, workshops, university courses, certification courses, and we’ll pay for the certs too. Want to learn a new skill that you aren’t currently using but want to? Great! Innovation is key–new technology is important.

  


**About ISE:**



ISE is an independent security consulting and software firm headquartered in Baltimore, Maryland, dedicated to securing high value assets for global enterprises and performing groundbreaking security research. Using an adversary-centric perspective driven by our elite team of analysts and developers, we improve our clients’ overall security posture, protect digital assets, harden existing technologies, secure infrastructures, and work with development teams to ensure product security prior to deployment. Our team enjoys working in a creative, educational, and comfortable environment where they can thrive professionally.

  


**Building a Better Community:**



We value different viewpoints and fresh perspectives. We embrace people who challenge our thinking and question the status quo. We are opposed to narrow minded, exclusionary, and discriminatory viewpoints or practices that inherently undermine our creative process, hinder growth, and impede innovation.

  


**Need more info?**



Be sure you spend some time at www.ise.io. Make sure you look through all the perks on the Careers page, then check out our Research and Blog, our events page for the IoT Village, and About page. Follow us on Twitter @ISEsecurity and @IoTvillage

title: Workday Sales Architect
description:
Founded by former Workday clients, we value partnership and engagement as a cornerstone of our business. With years of functional and technical experience in all phases of Workday's deployment life cycle, we can determine the most efficient integration designs and rapid deployment strategies. We develop maintainable solutions and provide support for integration testing and updates for new Workday releases.


As the Workday Sales Architect, you'll partner with our Sales team and provide solutions guidance and design/strategy support through the sales process to our future clients, specifically regarding their Workday HCM implementations. This can include functional and technical guidance, support for RFI's, RFP's and general proposals delivery.



You'll have broad Workday product knowledge with deep implementation expertise, which will enable you to guide the overall design (through the Architect phase) of the application through the sales process, and supporting the transition to the delivery team for a successful implementation.


**Responsibilities:**


* Support the Business Development Lifecycle by serving as product SME both internally and externally, assisting in qualifying business development opportunities
* Provide end to end solution and design details during the sales process
* Work with client to understand requirements and architect a solution and approach to address the requirements
* Present solution and Intecrowd capabilities to the customer.
* Support initial Intecrowd proposals while providing support throughout the proposal process, which may include providing Quality Assurance for respective service areas through delivery of the project
* Accurately estimate effort and resources required to complete projects as related to areas of expertise
* Provide input on project staffing based on requirements
* Work with Vice President of Delivery to help establish professional development opportunities in solution area
* Mentor and guide more junior colleagues
* Support the transition of the customer from Sales to Delivery. Provide guidance and solution recommendations to existing project teams (existing, in flight projects)
* Promote knowledge sharing across practices, which may include presenting at Intecrowd' trade shows or conferences


**Skills & Requirements:**


* Strong end-to-end implementation experience with HCM Information Systems required. Workday implementation experience preferred
* Ability to work in diverse, fast-paced environment and effectively collaborate across teams
* Ability to juggle multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously
* Ability to identify and analyze areas of risk and develop plans to minimize
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, presenting to a room of senior stakeholders is second nature to you
* Willingness to travel (25-50% at times)


This remote role can be located anywhere within the U.S. to perform the required responsibilities.



This position is not eligible for Visa sponsorship.


Employer's Rights:



Intecrowd has the right to revise this job description at any time. This job description is not a contract for employment. This job description does not list all the duties of the job. You may be asked by your supervisors or managers to perform other duties. You will be evaluated in part based upon your performance of the tasks listed in this job description.



Equal Opportunity Statement:



All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or status as a Vietnam or disabled veteran.



Applications for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Intecrowd.

title: Applications Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------

  

The Application Engineer is responsible for designing, developing, and installing business applications that support the Global Casino Team goals of increasing process automation, operational efficiency, and effectiveness. The Engineer will be capable of executing the complete software development lifecycle from gathering requirements, designing and developing solutions and providing post deployment support.


**Essential Functions:**


* Develop modern, secure software solutions that improve operational efficiency and effectiveness of various groups with Global Casino Operations for both shipboard & shoreside use.
* Provide post deployment support to troubleshoot and fix bugs in addition to enhancing & improving the solutions
* Establish effective relationships across the team to understand process gaps and develop a plan of action on how to solve them.
* Attend and participate in key business unit leadership meetings and collaborate with analytical teams within Global Casino Operations and brand partners
* Develop deep knowledge of existing system architecture both shipboard & shoreside to assist in guiding our technology roadmap


**Qualifications:**


* Bachelor’s degree
* Minimum five years of software development experience or equivalent combination of education & experience.


**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:**


* Ability to develop software in in various programming languages such as Java, HTML/CSS, etc. Excellent knowledge of relational databases.
* Prepared to work hands on with development efforts in addition to managing projects. Strong analytical & problem-solving skills. Skilled in research, audit & problem solving. Strong attention to detail, with a high degree of accuracy in work product. Superior written & oral communication skills. Effective communicator in framing and presenting a concept or hypotheses. Self-motivated with ability to work independently. Ability to manage time effectively, set priorities and meet deadlines. Ability to learn and adapt to change.


Physical Demands: Must be able to remain in a stationary position at a desk and/or computer for extended periods of time.



Travel: Less than 25% shipboard travel likely. Less than 25% non-shipboard travel likely.



Work Conditions: Work primarily in a climate controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential.



The range for this role’s base salary is $83,182 - $110,000. Offers to selected candidates will be made on a fair and equitable basis, taking into account specific job-related skills and experience.



At Carnival, your total rewards package is much more than your base salary. All non-sales roles participate in an annual cash bonus program, while sales roles have an incentive plan. Director and above roles may also be eligible to participate in Carnival’s discretionary equity incentive plan. Plus, Carnival provides comprehensive and innovative benefits to meet your needs, including:


* Health Benefits:
	+ Cost-effective medical, dental and vision plans
	+ Employee Assistance Program and other mental health resources
	+ Additional programs include company paid term life insurance and disability coverage
* Financial Benefits:
	+ 401(k) plan that includes a company match
	+ Employee Stock Purchase plan
* Paid Time Off
	+ Holidays – All full-time and part-time with benefits employees receive days off for 7 company-wide holidays, plus an additional floating holiday to be taken at the employee’s discretion.
	+ Vacation Time – All full-time employees at the manager and below level start with 14 days/year; director and above level start with 19 days/year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 84 hours/year. All employees gain additional vacation time with further tenure.
	+ Sick Time – All full-time employees receive 80 hours of sick time each year. Part-time with benefits employees receive time off based on the number of hours they work, with a minimum of 60 hours each year.
* Other Benefits
	+ Complementary stand-by cruises, employee discounts on confirmed cruises, plus special rates for family and friends
	+ Personal and professional learning and development resources including tuition reimbursement
	+ On-site preschool program and wellness center at our Miami campus

#LI-Remote



#LI-RM2

------------


In addition to other duties/functions, this position requires full commitment and support for promoting ethical and compliant culture. More specifically, this position requires integrity, honesty, and respectful treatment of others, as well as a willingness to speak up when they see misconduct or have concerns.  

  

Carnival Corporation & plc is a global cruise company and one of the largest vacation companies in the world. Our portfolio of leading cruise brands includes Carnival Cruise Line, Holland America Line, Princess Cruises and Seabourn in North America; P&O Cruises, and Cunard Line in the United Kingdom; AIDA in Germany; Costa Cruises in Southern Europe; and P&O Cruises in Australia. Our employees have a responsibility to be accountable for all actions. We consider the environment in all aspects of our business and have a responsibility to put safety andsustainability first. We live and share a positive attitude which is based on fostering an environment of inclusion, trust, a willingness to listen, openness and integrity.  

  

Carnival Corporation & plc and Carnival Cruise Line is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. In this regard, it does not discriminate against any qualified individual on the basis of sex, race, color, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, mental, physical or sensory disability or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, federal and/or international law.

title: Cloud Security Solution Architect
description:
**About Us:**
Atmosera is full lifecycle cloud technology transformation firm, offering application and data professional services, security & compliance management, Azure operations, and technology training.  

Our expertise across applications, data, and the Microsoft Azure platform allows us to accelerate innovation speed, increase operational agility, and vastly improve the return on investment in modern technology and human expertise.  

In this role, you will provide thought leadership to our clients, help design, scope and sell amazing projects with an emphasis on Cloud Security (Azure). You will help delivery teams fulfill the vision you've shaped. This role will directly support both our Business Development Managers to pursue new customer opportunities and our technical teams to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Keeping our skills cutting-edge is a must, and part of your role will be to share the same education and enthusiasm that you give our clients with our internal teams.  

An Atmosera Solution Architect knows what "Best Practices Industry-Standards" are and knows when an organization is ready to move in that direction and when to pragmatically make smaller steps instead to meet the customer's immediate need.  

As a Cloud Solution Architect at Atmosera you will take personal ownership of the technical envisioning, scope and goals of sales pursuits. The heart of this role is a passion for helping clients understand, adopt and improve an Azure presence, both in traditional, infrastructure-based approaches, App Modernization and new, platform-based architectures.
### **Responsibilities:**

* Pre-sales Leadership. Work with our outstanding Business Development team to identify client challenges, scope and estimate level of effort that address those challenges that our teams can solve and ultimately close the deal.
* Lead & Assess Engagements: You will model and lead projects that help clients review their existing portfolio of applications, determine cloud compatibility, perform cost / benefit analysis and build application migration and modernization roadmaps.
* Inspire Customers. Create energy around helping customers improve their technical agility through identifying customer needs within Atmosera’s core solution areas (described below)
* Agile Requirements Definition. Collaborate with clients to define requirements and translate them into user stories. Add vision to the project along the way.
* Technical Architecture. Validate, translate and align requirements into a technical design.
* Thought Leadership & Knowledge Management. You will help digest the flood of incoming information regarding new Azure features, development methodologies, libraries and tools to help our clients-and our team-stay ahead of the curve.
* Passion for Learning New Technologies. You are someone who continually seeks out new technologies within the four core solution areas of Atmosera (described below) offers or beyond, to facilitate and implement change. You also listen to the pulse of the technical world to help be at the forefront of technical solution architecture. You are a community leader within your specialty, and believe in sharing your skills with your community, through conferences, social media, blogging and other means.
* Microsoft Partnership Enhancement. Deepen our technical relationship with Microsoft by cultivating new and existing relationships to drive additional sales. Collaborate with the product team and help manage our application development competency

### **Required Experience & Skills:**

* Collaboration and active participation in a consulting environment. Experience in team selling of professional services, as well as sales through delivery efforts.
* Proficiency in professional technical architecture capabilities in App Modernization, DevOps, and Azure Infrastructure.
* Experience in discovering, understanding and solutioning high level application infrastructure that meets business and technical requirements.
* Broad understanding of development methods and technology stacks.
* Experience in discovering and solutioning DevOps engagements, specifically GitHub.
* Comfortable speaking to all levels from engineers and analysts to C-suite level people.
* Customer-facing presentations including leading meetings using whiteboards and collaboration tools.
* Technical documentation and writing.
* Experience designing end-to-end architectural solutions.
* Ability to determine application interdependencies and how those intersect with Azure infrastructure elements.
* Hands on experience with Microsoft Azure and a strong understanding of Azure capabilities and limitations.
* Broad exposure, through several projects, to the Azure PaaS services. Successful candidate should have a portfolio of solutions to many different types of business problems in Azure.

 **Atmosera’s Delivery Capabilities**  

Atmosera has developed a cloud maturity model that focuses on discrete solution areas: Datacenter Transformation, DevOps, Application Modernization, Data/AI, and Security. This approach allows Atmosera to shepherd an organization from its initial cloud adoption through its transformation to an industry disruptor, and to aid organizations at any point in their Azure journey in better leveraging, and accelerating their adoption of, beneficial cloud services.  

  

The most successful Solution Architects typically consider themselves to be proficient one or two of the core areas and quickly gain proficiency in the other areas. The successful candidate will be proficient in Azure Infrastructure, DevOps, and App Modernization initially.**Perks & Benefits:*** Health, vision, dental package including options for 100% paid employee coverage
* 401k with generous matching
* Company paid Life, AD&D, Short- and Long-Term Disability
* Performance-based compensation with bonus potential in addition to salary
* Employee Recognition and Reward Programs
* Community Service Leave

  

This is a full-time position in the United States with the ability to work from home, or from one of our many US offices if local.  

Atmosera is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  

  

We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.  

  

All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

title: BP1009599-Network Solutions Consultant
description:
**Solution Consultant - Federal Team**  

**US Citizenship**  

**Location: Remote US**

Juniper Networks provides strategic solution development, integration, and deployment services to our customers through the Professional Services organization. The Solution Consultant will work remotely, providing primarily post-sales delivery, and will deliver and own the success of all technical aspects of the customer deliverables. This role will have the technical and project experience to interface directly with sales and the customer to define the problem from the customer’s perspective and will have the ability to design/validate complex network and/or automation solutions involving multiple technical disciplines.


**Requirements:**

* Highly technical role providing post-sales Engineering Design/Architecture, Operational, and Support of Juniper products within a customer infrastructure.
* The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of Network Engineering Design/Architecture, Operational, and Support experience in Service Provider, Enterprise, and Data Center network environments.
* The candidate must have a detailed understanding of protocols used for IP networks and demonstratable technical expertise in the configuration, troubleshooting and operation of IP-based routers, switches, and security devices.
* The candidate will be flexible and comfortable working in multiple verticals: WAN/LAN Networking, MIST (wireless & wire), Data Center and automation.
* Support: MX, EX, QFX and SRX
* Solutions: MIST Wireline/Wireless, Apstra, Paragon, and other automation solutions.
* Travel: ~10% to 20% (based on project requirements)

**Qualifications:**

* Solid understanding of routing and switching protocols associated with IP networks: OSPF, IS-IS, ISIS-SR, BGP, MPLS, L3VPN, EVPN-VXLAN, multicast, associated tunneling technologies (GRE, IPsec, etc.), Class of Service (CoS), Filter-Based Forwarding (policy based static routing).
* Understanding of network security.
* Experience with Automation Frameworks, Linux, Virtualization, and Programming Languages.
* Preferred Automation/orchestration skills: Python and Ansible (leveraging PyEZ), CI/CD workflows & NetDevOps, docker, Netbox, GitLab.
* SD-WAN: 128T/SSR is a plus.
* Data Center Design and deployments leveraging Apstra or other Data Center orchestration platforms.
* MIST Wireless and/or wired is a plus.
* Paragon suite automation is a plus.
* Industry Certifications.- Juniper and/or Cisco

**Ideal Strengths** :


* Strong interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
* Ability to effectively work independently and function in a team environment.
* Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and work calmly under pressure.
* Ability to prioritize work activities to achieve customer goals and deliverables.

title: Sr Mgr, Bus Line Sales-IT Tech Sales
description:
Together, we can beat cancer.
At Varian, a Siemens Healthineers Company, we bring together the world's best talent to realize our vision of a world without fear of cancer. Together, we work passionately to develop and deliver easy-to-use, efficient oncology solutions.
We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.
If you want to be part of this important mission, we want to hear from you.
Technical Sales Business Line Manger: Manages business line sales for Managed Services for North America. Will lead a team of technical sales managers
Technical Sales Business Line Manger: Manages business line sales for Managed Services for North America. Will lead a team of technical sales managers in selling Managed Services to external and internal customers. This manager will focus on the business and technical aspects of the portfolio working with marketing, product management, sales management, finance, security, and service. This manager is responsible for a quota and assists the sales and marketing teams with developing plans and developing the organization to achieve this quota. Additional responsibilities include business reviews, employee feedback, forecasting, deal analysis, enterprise deal support, and training.
Performs all required management responsibilities including but not limited to implementing the company's policies, programs, and guidelines; ensuring employee productivity and growth; managing resources; knowing Varian's business; and maintaining functional, technical, and external market awareness necessary for managing immediate organization.
 Minimum Required Skills and Knowledge: Ability, competence, and confidence to lead people. Effective interpersonal skills. Understanding of Varian’s technical clinical solutions and how to sell them in the oncology space.
Other Desired Skills and Knowledge: Required Certifications and Training: Obtains and completes LMS training plan specific to assigned responsibility. Proficient in utilizing business tools such as: E-mail, Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint. Meets all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to gain VMS client site access, unless prohibited by law. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver’s license, SSN), Criminal background checks, and drug screenings.
Typical Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent 10 years of related experience. 2+ years management experience.
Position must have full access to Varian client sites to perform the essential functions of this position. Many clients require Varian employees and representatives to meet certain Vendor Credentialing requirements before they will be allowed to have access to their sites. Unless prohibited by law, position must meet all Vendor Credentialing requirements necessary to have full client access and must continue to meet those requirements during the course of employment in this position. These requirements vary by client and may include, but are not limited to: Proof of valid identification (photo, driver's license, SSN) Criminal background checks Drug screens Immunizations (COVID-19, Hep B, MMR, Varicella, Influenza, Tetanus) Annual TB testing Healthcare training
Fighting cancer calls for big ideas.
We envision a world without fear of cancer. Achieving this vision takes dedication and commitment from all of us, every single day. That's why we celebrate and value the distinctly beautiful and intersectional identities of each of our employees. We are a mirror of our patient-base, which allows us to innovate. Big ideas come from everywhere, and the best ideas are fostered by our unique individual experiences. At Varian, we encourage you to bring your whole self to work and believe your bold and authentic perspective will help to power more victories over cancer.
#TogetherWeFight
Privacy Statement
Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Varian is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, creed, religion, national origin, citizenship status, ancestry, sex, age, physical or mental disability unrelated to ability, marital status, family responsibilities, pregnancy, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender expression, gender identity, transgender, sex stereotyping, order of protection status, protected veteran or military status, or an unfavorable discharge from military service, and other categories protected by federal, state or local law.
EEO is the Law  

Applicants and employees are protected under Federal law from discrimination.

title: Solutions Engineer
description:
\\*\\*\\*WE ARE NOT OPEN TO WORKING WITH AGENCIES ON THIS POSITION\\*\\*\\*  

Second Front Systems (2F) is seeking a motivated Enterprise Solutions Engineer (SE) to support our team. We are a fast-growing entrepreneurial team working at the convergence of technology and national security. The work will be dynamic and wide-ranging within the Growth team supporting the rapid scaling of our Game Warden platform and future product offerings.  

We are growing quickly and need an experienced Solutions Engineer to play a key role in helping to secure future business and partnership initiatives. The SE will represent 2F as a technical SME during customer and market-facing engagements. This is a cross-functional role that will work with commercial sales, marketing, customer success, product, business development, and government engagement teams.  

**Note: This position requires U.S. citizenship.**
### **RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Work cross functionally to drive the adoption of our platform across a broad range of independent software vendors
* As a member of the Growth team, own the technical aspects of the direct engagements between customers and the platform
* Maintain close alignment with Account Executives to efficiently move prospects through the Sales Pipeline
* Participates in Go-To-Market efforts, including: Introduction calls, technical sales presentations, RFP/RFI responses, product demonstrations, architecture design discussions, and technical workshops
* Develop in-depth technical knowledge of Second Front products and represent 2F internally and externally as a technical SMEResponsible for analyzing and compiling competitor feedback and market research
* Track customer feedback and engage with 2F product teams to align roadmaps with demand signals
* Develop and review marketing content (blogs, posts, etc) and technical documentation to drive business development
* Evaluate complex cloud application architectures and assess compatibility with the Game Warden hosting platform with consideration for federal compliance requirementsTravel as needed to industry conferences and events

### **REQUIREMENTS**

* A self-starter who can work well independently and as part of a team
* Prior experience in a similar role and a strong track record of success in supporting complex, enterprise SaaS customers
* Experience in a client-facing role, ideally within the Defense Industrial Base (especially in sales, partnerships, business development, or customer success)
* Hands-on experience working with AWS, GCP, or Azure, where you are certified or eager to become certified
* Senior level experience in a technical role (e.g. software engineer, sales engineer, technical product manager) demonstrating creative problem solving and troubleshooting skills
* Hands-on software development, networking, or DevOps experience, preferably in conjunction with cloud technologies
* Ability to maintain composure in critical situations and communicate effectively with both internal and external customers
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to travel

### **PREFERRED QUALIFICATI0NS**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
* You demonstrate the ability to communicate, present, and influence credibly and effectively at all levels of the organization
* Previous experience, knowledge, or certifications relating to cybersecurity
* Experience working with some/all of our tech stack: AWS, Kubernetes, Docker, Helm, Istio, Git, Gitlab, Terraform, Relational DBs
* Experience working in a startup environment
* Ability to adopt, create, and iterate on changing procedures in near-real time
* Knowledge of DevSecOps tools and practices
* COMPTIA Security+ or CISSP certification
* Active Security Clearance (TS-SCI)

  

This role is full-time. As a public benefit corporation, we’re a team of purpose-driven trailblazers transforming the future of U.S. national security. We hire the best to do their best and, as such, we are committed to providing the perks and benefits you need to be successful—both in- and outside the workplace.  

  

We offer you:
Competitive Salary
100% Healthcare, vision and dental coverage
401(k) + 3% company contribution
Wellness perks (Fitness classes, mental health resources)
Equity incentive plan
Tech + office supplies stipend
Annual professional development stipend
Flexible paid time off + federal holidays off
Parental leave
Work from anywhere
Referral Bonus  

Visit our careers page to learn more. **WHO WE ARE**
At Second Front Systems (2F), we equip defense and national security professionals for long-term, continuous competition for access to emerging technologies. Founded by two former U.S. Marines with firsthand experience of the dangers outdated technology poses in combat, our team is dedicated to fast-tracking government access to disruptive, commercially-proven technology for U.S. national security missions.  

Our Game Warden product, a fully managed and compliant DevSecOps platform, accelerates the process for accrediting software as a service (SaaS) applications for government use.  

Learn how 2F can help you make an impact on national security missions at www.secondfront.com **ONE LAST THING…**
Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria  

We strongly encourage you to apply if you’re interested—We'd love to know how you can amplify our team with your unique experience.

title: Account Executive (Microsoft Dynamics)
description:
About the position::
**Velosio is looking for an Enterprise Account Executive, to be an integral member of our Sales Team.**  

As an **Enterprise** **Account Executive** at Velosio, you will be responsible for generating revenue by acquiring new strategic Clients by focusing on selling Velosio solutions and services. The Enterprise Account Executive will be expected to self-generate leads, establish relationships with Microsoft Field Sellers, follow through on leads assigned from other sources and drive new prospect introductions to identify new opportunities.
Who we are::

At Velosio, we focus on what matters most - **our people.** We are a values-driven organization committed to delivering an outstanding employee experience to all our team members.  

Velosio’s years of experience with business applications translate to a deep bench of tenured team members with competency across enterprise resource management (ERP), customer relationship management (CRM), and cloud services.  

We have earned recognition from Microsoft as a top 1% performing partner worldwide and an emerging NetSuite leader. We have strategic independent software vendor (ISV) partnerships and a portfolio of solution and service offerings to accelerate what’s next for business.  

Our mission is to enable clients to realize business value faster, simplify the process of deploying technology, acquire deeper data-driven insights, and explore ongoing innovation to drive business forward. We support the entire Microsoft Dynamics portfolio, Office 365 family and Azure services. Velosio is the only Microsoft Cloud Distributor that specializes in Dynamics 365 and is a prominent Microsoft Master VAR. Headquartered in Columbus, Ohio, Velosio’s 400 employees serve over 4,000 clients.  

Beyond our expertise, as a Velosio team member, you can leverage the Velosio award winning culture - a network of top-notch peers, day-to-day flexibility, career development resources and the largest incentive opportunities in the industry.
Your day might look like::
* Meet established sales quotas and revenue goals on a consistent basis.
+ Generate and maintain a pipeline of new business.
+ Initiate contact to identify and qualify new revenue opportunities.
+ Follow up with prospects to review proposed solutions and pricing, determine project start dates, and obtain signed contracts.
+ Oversee proposal generation process.
+ Lead negotiations, coordinate decision-making process, and overcome objections to close sales in a timely manner.
+ Consult with prospects and clients to assess their business needs; Introduce Velosio Cloud solutions and strategy to prospects.
+ Accurately reflect opportunities in Velosio CRM solution.

* Acquire and maintain product knowledge to support products and services.
* Work with fellow Team Members from the Velosio Delivery Practices and solution architects as needed to identify each prospect’s business needs/expectations and to develop demonstrations and presentations, generate reports, and gather data as needed to support the sales process.
* Manage contacts and sales activity and be able to accurately forecast via internal CRM system in an accurate and timely fashion.
* Participate in and/or lead various business development and marketing events involving prospects/clients.
* Network with fellow professionals and drive your own pipeline.


What you'll bring::
* Bachelor’s Degree, preferably in business, MIS, IT, or related field
* 5 years of Modern Workplace, Azure & D365 applications sales experience
* 5 years of experience in outside sales
* Proficient in CRM and Microsoft Office solutions
* Strong listening and investigative skills to identify client problems.
* Strategic thinking and ability to develop solutions from a stated problem.
* Written and oral communication skills including, but not limited to, leading presentations, creating reports, etc.
* Client-service focus including solid judgement, ethics, and professionalism.
* Experience in selling to C-Suite.
* Experience working in quota driven competitive sales environment.

**You might also bring:**

* Experience working for a Microsoft Partner organization or similar competitor.
* Knowledge of ERP, Cloud, CRM, and SaaS solutions.


Some reasons you might like working with us::

At Velosio, **YOU MATTER.**

  



Due to our proven commitment to delivering an exemplary employee experience, Velosio was awarded **Best Company Culture** and **Best Company for Women** by Comparably in 2023, 2022 and 2021, in addition to **Best Company for Career Growth**, **Best Perks & Benefits**, and **Best Leadership Team** by Comparably in 2022 and 2023!

  

Access the following link to see why **100%** of current Velosio team members feel their company is invested in their career growth, **99%** of current Velosio employees feel their manager cares about them as a person, and **99%** of current Velosio team members look forward to interacting with their coworkers every day:


https://www.comparably.com/companies/velosio

  

At Velosio, **YOUR WELLNESS MATTERS.**

  

We know one size doesn't fit all, which is why we offer a comprehensive benefits package that allows our team members to create a personalized plan best suited for their unique needs, including:


* 3 Medical Insurance options with a company contribution to HSA
* 3 Dental Insurance options including adult orthodontics
* 3 Vision Insurance options
* PTO with added time with each year of service
* Remote working environment
* 401k Match 50% of the first 6%
* StayWell Program – a cash reimbursement up to $600 a year toward Wellness
* Quarterly Incentive Program

title: Microsoft D365 Solutions Architect (Finance)
description:
Remote


High performing team members. Challenging projects. A stable and profitable company. And a great place to work! This is what you can expect if you join the Quisitive team. Founded in 2016, Quisitive is a publicly traded, global Microsoft partner specializing in Microsoft platform and complementary technologies, custom solutions, and offerings that drive digital transformation and business value for enterprise customers. Our team of professionals has a long history of successfully delivering award-winning Microsoft solutions, and our culture of continual learning ensures that we remain committed to Microsoft’s long-term strategy. *Quisitive was recently named the 2023 Microsoft US Health and Life Sciences AND Solution Assessments Partner of the Year*.

What do we attribute our award-winning success to? The people we hire, of course! People don’t join the Quisitive team for a job. They come to Quisitive to build a career – to continue their infinite quest to learn; to deliver on the most innovative and exciting work of their lives; and to be part of a high-performing and fun culture. We’ll provide you the tools and leadership that you need to be successful, and let you do what you do best!

It is a very exciting time of growth for our Global Business Applications (GBA) team, and we are currently hiring a Microsoft D365 Solutions Architect (Finance) to provide leadership for our team and projects. *This role can be located anywhere in the United States.*

What will my role be?

As a D365 Solutions Architect you will:
* Have an overall strong knowledge of both technical and functional aspects of D365
* Support multiple projects as the oversight for system design and quality assurance
* Train, guide and coach consultants/senior consultants
* Full lifecycle project duties including:
	+ Pre-sales solution engineering, project definition/estimation, business requirements analysis, QA functional design and ongoing QA activities related to the build and deploy phases
* Assist in the sales discovery phase with the ability to help estimate the work plan required to turn the prospect into a proposal
* Create gap analysis between standard functionality and the customer’s requirements
* Identify and recommend product customizations, enhancements, or workarounds to meet the customer's requirements
* Understand documentation standards, and QA documentation required for enhancements and integrations
* Assist industry leads in estimating the steps in formulating their solution maps (based on industry knowledge)
* Identify, scope, develop, and present new solutions (out of scope of project) to the customer


What’s required?
* Knowledge of D365 customization process (tools, LCS, TFS, etc.)
* Experience with integration and data migration tools
* SME in Finance
* Strong experience in secondary areas; Project Accounting, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Sales and Marketing, Case management or Field Services
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Good problem solving, analytical, time management, and organizational skills
* Good business acumen
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
* Ability to travel to customer meetings when required


What would set me apart?
* Previous consulting experience in a customer-facing role
* Experience with key Industries; Healthcare, Manufacturing, or Education
* Full life cycle D365 implementation experience
* Experience in presales activities including, solution demo, industry SME, estimating and creating SOW's.


We are looking for curious initiative takers to join our team, so if you are passionate about being a leader and working with smart people that are committed to accomplishing great things, then apply today!
*No agencies or third parties, please.* *We are unable to offer visa sponsorships at this time.*

About Quisitive  



With significant growth since 2016, Quisitive is rapidly achieving our vision of becoming the premier, global Microsoft partner, and we continue to expand across the United States, Canada and India. Our teams have grown by diversifying our delivery model to include nearshore and offshore capabilities. Within our growing Global Cloud Solutions business, we deliver technical business solutions through a portfolio of IP solutions aligned to industry or business function to accelerate customer business goals, and we deliver technical cloud solutions to help customers achieve their digital transformation goals. In addition, Quisitive has a portfolio of industry-focused solutions that address customer challenges in healthcare, manufacturing, state & local government, performance management, and payment processing.

title: Microsoft D365 Solutions Architect (Supply Chain)
description:
Remote


High performing team members. Challenging projects. A stable and profitable company. And a great place to work! This is what you can expect if you join the Quisitive team. Founded in 2016, Quisitive is a publicly traded, global Microsoft partner specializing in Microsoft platform and complementary technologies, custom solutions, and offerings that drive digital transformation and business value for enterprise customers. Our team of professionals has a long history of successfully delivering award-winning Microsoft solutions, and our culture of continual learning ensures that we remain committed to Microsoft’s long-term strategy. *Quisitive was recently named the 2023 Microsoft US Health and Life Sciences AND Solution Assessments Partner of the Year*.

What do we attribute our award-winning success to? The people we hire, of course! People don’t join the Quisitive team for a job. They come to Quisitive to build a career – to continue their infinite quest to learn; to deliver on the most innovative and exciting work of their lives; and to be part of a high-performing and fun culture. We’ll provide you the tools and leadership that you need to be successful, and let you do what you do best!

It is a very exciting time of growth for our Global Business Applications (GBA) team, and we are currently hiring a D365 Solutions Architect- Supply Chain to provide technical leadership for our Dynamics team. *This role can be located anywhere in the United States.*

What will my role be?

As a D365 Solution Architect, you will be part of a team developing and implementing Dynamics 365 solutions for Quisitive customers. In addition, you will provide oversight for the systems design and quality assurance (QA) support across multiple enterprise projects. You will serve as a subject matter expert (SME) and assist in pre-sales pursuits with our Sales team.

What’s required?
* Experience implementing most current versions of D365
* Full life cycle D365 implementation experience and knowledge of D365 customization process (LCS, TFS, etc.)
* 8+ years consulting experience in a customer-facing role
* Experience with integration and data migration tools
* Subject matter expertise in Supply Chain
* Experience in secondary areas such as Finance, Project Accounting, Sales and Marketing, Case Management or Field Services
* Credible and professional presence with the ability to develop productive customer and team relationships
* Good written and verbal communication skills
* Good problem solving, analytical, time management, and organizational skills
* Some travel will be required during the course of delivering customer solutions
* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience


What would set me apart?
* Experience leading project teams through design workshops and pilot programs
* Experience with QA reviews and testing strategies
* Relevant experience in key industries; Healthcare, Manufacturing, or Education
* Experience in presales activities including solutions demos, presenting as an industry SME, estimating and creating statements of work/proposals


We are looking for curious initiative takers to join our team, so if you are passionate about being a leader and working with smart people that are committed to accomplishing great things, then apply today!
*No agencies or third parties.*
*US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. We are unable to offer visa sponsorships at this time.*

About Quisitive

With significant growth since 2016, Quisitive is rapidly achieving our vision of becoming the premier, global Microsoft partner, and we continue to expand across the United States and Canada. Our teams have grown across three continents by diversifying our delivery model to include nearshore and offshore capabilities, a robust Microsoft Dynamics division and related portfolio of industry IP, and most recently, joining forces with Catapult Systems which doubled the capabilities of our Cloud Solutions business and established a robust Security practice.

Within our growing Global Cloud Solutions business, we deliver technical business solutions through a portfolio of IP solutions aligned to industry or business function to accelerate customer business goals, and we deliver technical cloud solutions to help customers achieve their digital transformation goals. In addition, Quisitive has a portfolio of industry-focused solutions that address customer challenges in healthcare, manufacturing, state & local government, performance management, and payment processing.

description:
